attributes.action: That whips and the practice of parliamentary whipping be abolished.
attributes.additional_details: Elected representatives should vote according to the wishes of their constituents and not party policy dictats nor their consciences. Neither should their careers suffer as a result. The use of force to achieve the aim of a few is a corruption of true democracy. It is my belief that HS2 is an example of this where I have reasonable anecdotal evidence of this. It is my belief that if parties or governments need whipping to secure policies then the policy probably runs against the people's wishes.
attributes.background:
For example the use of whips to direct party MPs to force the securing of a policy that may run contrary to constituents wishes.
In a true democracy it is the will of the people that elected their representatives that should prevail and not party policies or elected representatives consciences.

rejection.details: This is a matter for political parties, not the UK Government or the House of Commons as a whole.
